history.proof: intros E A P H IN_A_E P_A. shelve.

ctx: intros E A P H IN_A_E P_A.

ctx: intros E A P H IN_A_E P_A.
exceptions.exn: In environment E, A : Ens P : Ens -> Prop H : forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2 IN_A_E : IN A E P_A : P A Unable to unify "forall E : Ens, IN E (Comp ?M1435 ?M1436) -> IN E ?M1435" with "match Comp E P with | sup A0 f => EXType A0 (fun y : A0 => EQ A (f y)) end".

ctx: intros E A P H IN_A_E P_A.
exceptions.exn: Unable to find an instance for the variable E.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A E -> P A -> IN A (Comp E P)

Premises:
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Comp = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => (Ens -> Prop) -> Ens) (fun (A : Type) (f : A -> Ens) (_ : A -> (Ens -> Prop) -> Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop) => sup (sig A (fun x : A => P (f x))) (fun X0 : sig A (fun x : A => P (f x)) => sig_rect A (fun x : A => P (f x)) (fun _ : sig A (fun x : A => P (f x)) => Ens) (fun (x : A) (_ : P (f x)) => f x) X0)) X : Ens -> (Ens -> Prop) -> Ens Arguments Comp _ _%function_scope
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
IN_Comp_P : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A (Comp E P) -> P A
Comp_INC : forall (E : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), INC (Comp E P) E
Paire_IN : forall E E' A : Ens, IN A (Paire E E') -> EQ A E \/ EQ A E'
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rec : forall P : Ens -> Set, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
sig_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : sig A P -> Prop), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (exist A P x p)) -> forall s : sig A P, P0 s
sig_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : sig A P -> Type), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (exist A P x p)) -> forall s : sig A P, P0 s
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> sig A P
tout_vide_est_Vide : forall E : Ens, (forall E' : Ens, IN E' E -> F) -> EQ E Vide
INC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, IN E E1 -> IN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> sig A P Arguments sig _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments exist _%type_scope _%function_scope
IN_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> IN E E' -> IN E E''
IN_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> IN E E'' -> IN E' E''
sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens
BinNat.N.bi_induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A n <-> A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
BinInt.Z.le_ind : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m -> A (BinInt.Z.succ m)) -> forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m
EXType_ind : forall (P : Type) (Q : P -> Prop) (P0 : Prop), (forall x : P, Q x -> P0) -> EXType P Q -> P0
IN_Sing_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, IN E (Sing E') -> EQ E E'
Paire_sound_right : forall A B B' : Ens, EQ B B' -> EQ (Paire A B) (Paire A B')
Paire_sound_left : forall A A' B : Ens, EQ A A' -> EQ (Paire A B) (Paire A' B)
Sing_sound : forall A A' : Ens, EQ A A' -> EQ (Sing A) (Sing A')
Vide_est_vide : forall E : Ens, IN E Vide -> F
ssrbool.introTF : forall (P : Prop) (b c : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> (if c then P else ~ P) -> b = c
ssrbool.equivPif : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> (Q -> P) -> (P -> Q) -> if b then Q else ~ Q
Refl.make_impl : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop -> Prop
RingMicromega.Op1_rect : forall P : RingMicromega.Op1 -> Type, P RingMicromega.Equal -> P RingMicromega.NonEqual -> P RingMicromega.Strict -> P RingMicromega.NonStrict -> forall o : RingMicromega.Op1, P o
BinNat.N.min_case_strong : forall (n m : BinNums.N) (P : BinNums.N -> Type), (BinNat.N.le n m -> P n) -> (BinNat.N.le m n -> P m) -> P (BinNat.N.min n m)
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
EXTypei : forall (P : Type) (Q : P -> Prop) (x : P), Q x -> EXType P Q
INC_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, INC E E' -> INC E' E -> EQ E E'
Paire = fun E E' : Ens => sup bool (fun H : bool => bool_rect (fun _ : bool => Ens) E E' H) : Ens -> Ens -> Ens
INC_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'' -> INC E' E''
INC_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> INC E E' -> INC E E''
Inductive clos_trans_1n (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t1n_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x y | t1n_trans : forall y z : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_trans _%type_scope
Inductive reflect (P : Prop) : bool -> Set := ReflectT : P -> Bool.reflect P true | ReflectF : ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false Arguments Bool.reflect _%type_scope _%bool_scope Arguments Bool.ReflectT _%type_scope Arguments Bool.ReflectF _%type_scope
ssrbool.AltTrue : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), P -> ssrbool.alt_spec P b true
ssrbool.decPcases : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> if b then P else ~ P
EQ_INC : forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'

```    
intros E A P H IN_A_E P_A.
apply (H A (Comp E P) P_A).
apply Comp_INC.
apply IN_Comp_P; assumption.
```

original: intros E A P H IN_A_E P_A. apply (H A (Comp E P) P_A). apply Comp_INC. apply IN_Comp_P; auto.
